### Visualisation

<div style="height: auto; overflow-y: scroll;">

```{r}

read_csv("compmus2025.csv")

# Identify your own tracks (replace with actual track identifiers)

my_tracks <- compmus2025 %>%
  filter(filename == "filename") 

# Modify this condition to match your tracks

          
  # Start with the data
  # Calculate average feature values for corpus
avg_features <- compmus2025 %>%
  summarise(across(c(approachability, arousal, danceability, engagingness, 
                     instrumentalness, tempo, valence), mean, na.rm = TRUE))


plot <- ggplot(compmus2025, aes(x = tempo, y = arousal, size = instrumentalness, colour = danceability)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +  # Scatter plot
  geom_point(data = my_tracks, aes(x = tempo, y = arousal), colour = "red", size = 4, shape = 4) +  # Highlight your tracks
  geom_hline(yintercept = avg_features$arousal, linetype = "dashed", color = "blue") +  # Average arousal line
  geom_vline(xintercept = avg_features$tempo, linetype = "dashed", color = "blue") +  # Average tempo line
  labs(title = "Track Feature Visualization", x = "Tempo", y = "Arousal", size = "Instrumentalness", colour = "Danceability") +
  theme_minimal()
  
ggplotly(plot) %>% layout(height = 600)

```
